notes: Paper; light cream color, high quality, heavy laid paper with no visible chain lines or watermarks; black ink with rubrication; elaborate unwan preceding text in red, yellow, green, and black; fol. 1b only has border of  a black line with an inner border of thin red, wide green, and thin red line; catchwords.
Nastaʻliq; 13 lines in written area 14 x 8 cm.
Library of Congress. Persian manuscript, M137.
Red leather Indian binding with embossed medallions front and back, highlighted in light grey with a floral design; border of darker red leather with repetitive design also in grey.
Also available in digital form on the Library of Congress website.
item.title: Qiṣṣah-ʼi Sayf al-Mulūk va Badīʻ al-Jamāl.
summary: Tale of Sayf al-Mulūk and Badiʼʻ al-Jamāl, also recorded in an Arabic version in the Arabian Nights.
medium: 87 leaves (13 lines), paper : bound ; 19.3 x 14 cm
other_title: قصۀ سيف الملوك و بديع الجمال.
Qiṣṣah-ʼi ʻishq al-juzʼ al-awwal Sayf al-Mulūk va Badīʻ al-Jamāl

india
